Selian Lutheran Hospital is a local faith-based organization that provides comprehensive integrated HIV/AIDS services to PLHIV within the Evangelical Lutheran Church of Tanzania (ELCT) health facilities network in the Northern Diocese of Arusha and Manyara regions. The PEPFAR-supported program covers 42 wards in four districts. This program is aligned with the first Partnership Framework goal of focusing on service maintenance and scale up and with the GHI Strategy objective to build capacity of local actors for sustainable country ownership. Selian will continue to provide high quality comprehensive and sustainable clinical and community based HIV/AIDS services. The program will increase client access to ART treatment, care and support, PMTCT option B+, counseling and testing services, home based care (HBC), care for orphans and vulnerable children (OVC), TB/HIV services, cervical cancer screening, and family planning, and reproductive health services. The full array of services will be offered at Selian’s four largest facilities and by collaborating with other PEPFAR/T partners, local organizations and government systems in their regions program linkages and efficiencies will be achieved. Selian will improve the technical and managerial capacity of facilities and community-based programs in its network. The Selian M&E system is aligned with the National AIDS Control Programme’s M&E Framework, which includes monthly and quarterly data aggregation and analysis. Funds allocated for Program Element HL.1.6: Adult Care and Support. All facility-based and home/community-based activities for HIV-infected adults and their families aimed at extending and optimizing quality of life for HIV-infected clients and their families throughout the continuum of illness through provision of clinical, psychological, spiritual, social and prevention services. Funds allocated for Program Element HL.1.8: Orphans and Vulnerable Children. Activities are aimed at improving the lives of orphans and other vulnerable children (OVC) affected by HIV/AIDS, and doing so in a measurable way. Funds allocated for Program Element HL.1.11: Treatment/Adult Treatment. Including infrastructure, training clinicians and other providers, exams, clinical monitoring, related laboratory services, and community-adherence activities. Funds allocated for Program Element HL.1.9: Counseling and Testing. Includes activities in which both HIV counseling and testing are provided for those who seek to know their HIV status (as in traditional VCT) or provider initiated counseling and testing. Funds allocated for Program Element HL.1.7: TB/HIV. Includes exams, clinical monitoring, related laboratory services, treatment and prevention of tuberculosis (including medication), as well as screening and referral of TB clinic clients for HIV testing and clinical care. Funds allocated for Program Element HL.1.1: Preventing Mother-to-Child Transmission (PMTCT). Activities (including training) aimed at preventing mother-to-child HIV transmission, including ARV prophylaxis for HIV-infected pregnant women and newborns and counseling and support for maternal nutrition. Funds allocated for Program Element HL.1.17: Pediatric Care and Support. All health facility-based care for HIV-exposed children and their families aimed at extending and optimizing quality of life for HIV-infected clients and their families throughout the continuum of illness through provision of clinical, psychological, spiritual, social and prevention services. Funds allocated for Program Element HL.1.18: Treatment/Pediatric Treatment. Including infrastructure, training clinicians and other providers, exams, clinical monitoring, related laboratory services, and community-adherence activities. objectives
